column4: does any one know how to mount the ubuntu partition on HDD in live cd?
do you know the partition?
the number, type; what about it
open a term:
i know, but it give me this:  wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/hda1
is it formatted?
yes
i just checked it under gparted now
its ext3
try this:  cat /dev/hda1 | file -
it returns: /dev/stdin: ERROR: error while writing to temp file (No space left on device)
I can verify that my partition is in fact an ext3 partition by doing that.    I get /dev/stdin: Linux rev 1.0 ext3 filesystem data (needs journal recovery)
does this mean my partition is corrupt?
not necessarily .. live cd's are weird.
how else can i go about this then
Do you have a /dev/hda1?
yes
How about a /dev/stdin?
hda1 is ubuntu, hda2 is windows and hda3 is the ram space
not ram phyical, fake ram, like windows paging file
dd if=/dev/hda1 | file -
dd: opening `/dev/hda1': Permission denied
sudo
k
/dev/stdin: ERROR: error while writing to temp file (No space left on device)
hrm.
do that with /dev/hda2
bash: cd: /dev/stdin: Not a directory, just tried cd to /dev/stdin, seems it doesnt exist
ls -al /dev/stdin
/dev/stdin: ERROR: error while writing to temp file (No space left on device)
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 15 2006-12-23 17:55 /dev/stdin -> /proc/self/fd/0
mount | grep proc
proc on /proc type proc (rw)
I'm thinking it's just a livecd issue.
then how can i back up all my stuff with out mounting the hdd
you weren't using lvm, were you?
lvm?
logical volume manager
not sure if i did, but i think i didnt
You have a knoppix CD lying around?
want me to look at GParted?
nope :(
my other pc doesnt have a cd burner ether
and you're using the ubuntu live cd.
yes
I'm going to boot into the livecd ....
Okay... I just booted into it and it worked for me.....
weird, i've done it before, but now it wont
what's your swap partition.
what do you mean?
Do you have a swap partition for ubuntu?
/dev/hda3 is extended and /dev/hda5 sits inside it as swap
Okay.... sudo swapon /dev/hda5
swapon: /dev/hda5: Device or resource busy, if your trying to mount it, i think its already, if i go by GParted, it says its locked
my swap is 2.58 gb, if that makes a difference
i can mount the windows HDD partition, but not the ubuntu one
I'm thinking it's corrupted.... I thinking about how to prove whether or not it is.
i hope it isnt, theres alot of stuff on there i need
and i have around 80% backed up
There's always fsck
fsck?
fsck /dev/hda1
its says "Group descriptors" but its only just started, still running, i'll give you it all in a paste bin in a sec
did you install windows after ubuntu?
yes, unfortunatly
i've noticed it says "/dev/hda1 was not cleanly unmounted, check forced."
that's good.
did it say ext3?
it also asks if i want to "Free blocks count wrong for group #1 (0, counted=1)."
it doesnt say atal
then saying if i want to correct it
before you answer yes...
put what you have in a pastebin
k
http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/843855
Yes... it looks like it is in fact corrupted.
so fsck is now the proper path.
should i try rebooting now?
No.
what now then?
well... at this point it looks like you may have possibly lost data.
i just tried mounting HDA1, it worked
i'll go check out the damage
lost blocks are usually in lost+found
it seems all my important stuff is availible, i'll back it up then install windows then ubuntu again
would that be ok?
yes... that would be appropriate now.
I think if I remember correctly windows mucks with all partitions even ones that it doesn't install to.
thanks for the help, you've let me sleep easy tonight, knowing all my stuff is safely backed up
np
would there be a way to back up my deb package lists?
thanks, i'll google it
i just needed the name (dpkg) :P forgot it
